quoteLast: , where the directors alighted and changed engines.  The train arrived at Rugby at 11 o’clock, where the Duke of Sussex and his suite alighted, and proceeded by carriage to the place of his destination.
title: Gossip in the First Decade of Victoria's Reign
author: Ashton, John, 1834-1911

quoteFirst: Makes this month a direct motion of four degrees and two seconds of arc, a greater advance than he has made for several months. He rises after daylight and sets on the 1st at
quoteLast: , on the 15th at 8:19 p. m., and on the 30th at 7:29 p. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, May 1884, No. 8
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: ; and on the 31st, at 9:28 p. m. Its motion is direct, and about 45′. Its diameter, 2.6″. On the 2nd, at 12:30 p. m., 27′ north of moon; on the 29th, at
quoteLast: , 38′ north of moon, making, as does also Saturn, two conjunctions with the moon in one month. On the 27th, about 9 p. m., it will be in conjunction with and 3° 34′ south of Venus.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, March 1884, No. 6
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]
